before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"22irh","text":"Required PPE: All work must be done wearing appropriate PPE including lab coat and gloves. Proper safety precautions should be taken into account while working with and disposing human tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"brqej","text":"In this protocol, we describe how to perform spatial ATAC-seq on fresh-frozen human dorsal root ganglion. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"6dm0t","text":"All human tissue recovery, research and data handling is performed in accordance with the University of Texas at Dallas Institutional Review Board (IRB) regulations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: ATAC-seq, spatial ATAC-seq, human DRG, chromatin, epigenomics
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"3nugv","text":"Key materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bqp7","text":"OCT - Fisher HealthCare (Cat. No. 23-730-571)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkp7t","text":"SuperFrost Plus charged slides - Fisher Scientific (Cat. No. 12–550-15)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fr227","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ceh4","text":"Service","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"en6c3","text":"Spatial ATAC-seq technology product (AXO-0310); Microfluidic barcoding system.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3itl9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbvgg","text":"Additional materials and equipment required","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88fhe","text":"Dry ice","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ar4ha","text":"Stainless steel base mold - Ted Pella (Cat. No. 27276-6)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kp2h","text":"Cryostat Leica CM1950","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hqle","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kl7u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o8io","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Nat Genet 53(3):403-411.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":9,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":124,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fr4cs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2djeo","text":"Zhang H, et al. (2021) Fast alignment and preprocessing of chromatin profiles with Chromap. Nat Commun 12(1):6566.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":7,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":92,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90psh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1isot","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ana0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b33e7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah6sj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cties","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cs1s1","text":"Surgically excised lumbar L4 or L5 human dorsal root ganglia (hDRGs) are obtained from organ donors at Southwest Transplant Alliance (STA) at 2 h post cross-clamp. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3jdbr","text":"Right after dissection, tissue is fresh frozen on powdered dry ice and stored at -80 °C until processing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ncgn","text":"Frozen hDRGs are embedded in OCT (Optimal Cutting Temperature embedding medium) in a cryomold by adding small volumes of OCT over dry ice to avoid thawing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1llq6","text":"Tissues are cryostat sectioned at 10 μm onto SuperFrost Plus charged slides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1pi3","text":"Slides are briefly warmed to allow the sections to adhere to the slides but are immediately returned to the −20 °C cryostat chamber until sectioning is complete.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5d31d","text":"The slides are removed from the cryostat and stored in a -80 °C freezer until shipment to AtlasXomics for further processing. Samples are shipped on dry ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avult","text":"Spatial ATAC-seq assay is performed at AtlasXomics (Product code: AXO-0310; https://www.atlasxomics.com/howitworks).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dufvs","text":"Processing of spatial ATAC-seq is perfomed by AtlasXomics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbr09","text":"In brief, tissue is fixed with 0.2% formaldehyde in PBS for 5 min and quenched with 1.25 M glycine for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agqgl","text":"After fixation, tissue is washed with PBS and nuclease-free water and left to dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"boghl","text":"Tissue sections are permeabilized for 15 min with a buffer containing 10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.4, 10 mM NaCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.01% Tween-20, 0.1% NP40, 0.001% digitonin and 1%BSA, and washed with a solution containing 10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.4, 10 mM NaCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.1% Tween-20 and 1%BSA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":114,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":254,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1gm3","text":"Tn5 transposition on the fixed hDRG sections is carried out at 37ºC for 30 min. Transposition reaction buffer contains tagmentation buffer, 0.1% Tween-20, 0.01% digitonin, PBS and Tn5). Transposition reaction is stopped with 40 μM EDTA for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1bs2e","text":"To correlate spatially barcoded accessible chromatin with tissue morphology, images of hDRG sections are acquired (Keyence BZ-X810 at 10X magnification).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fh6vk","text":"The tissue is lysed using a reverse cross-linking solution containing 200 nM NaCl, 50 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA, 1% SDS and 0.4 mg/mL proteinase K at 58°C for 2 h to release DNA fragments, which are then purified and amplified through PCR for library preparation using standard Next Generation Sequencing methods. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hkof","text":"150X150 paired-end sequencing is performed on a NextSeq 2000 with 15% PhiX. A total of 300 million reads per sample are targeted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4nrji","text":"Use Chromap to trim sequencing adapters, align sequenced reads to the human reference genome GRCh38/hg38 and remove duplicates from fastq files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":3,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6d8j","text":"Fragments files containing coordinates of sequenced DNA mapping to barcodes are generated for downstream analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7b5l5","text":"Use AtlasXbrowser to designate pixels on tissue based on microscopy images and to create Seurat-compatible metadata files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":4,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5jfsh","text":"Use ArchR to process fragments files and remove pixels not on tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":4,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"17aqm","text":"At this point of the processing, the .tsv fragments file contains the filtered aligned reads which can be used to proceed with peak calling. We have provided a tissue_positions_list.csv file containing a table with rows corresponding to the 2500 spots on the array, high- and low-resolution images of the tissue, a scale_factors.json file, and experiment metadata. Together, these files can help for further processing of spatial ATAC-seq analysis using ArchR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":454,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p0ai","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fbqm","text":"A brief description of some of the provided files is shown below. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ue30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aadna","text":"tissue_positions_list.csv","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4c2hg","text":"Columns on the file tissue_positions_list.csv correspond to:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mg75","text":"Column 1: barcode","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9uunn","text":"Column 2: in_tissue binary status indicating if the spot falls on a tissue spot","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df6p","text":"Column 3: array row ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ktj4","text":"Column 4: array column ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kth0","text":"Column 5: the row pixel coordinate of the center of the spot in the full resolution image ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dsuv","text":"Column 6: the column pixel coordinate of the center of the spot in the full resolution image ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvtjo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8e1dk","text":"scale_factors.json","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tftv","text":"Parameters in the scale_factors.json file correspond to the relative scales of the supplied image and the array barcode features. Four aspects are provided:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4osa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es7mq","text":"fiducial_diameter_fullres: Number of pixels spanning the diameter of a fiducial spot in the original, high-resolution image","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi48b","text":"spot_diameter_fullres: Number of pixels spanning the diameter of a spot in the original, high-resolution image","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tj5e","text":"tissue_highres_scalef: Scaling factor to convert pixel positions in the original, full-resolution image to pixel positions in the provided high resolution image (.png file)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gnra","text":"tissue_lowres_scalef: Scaling factor to convert pixel positions in the original, full-resolution image to pixel positions in the provided low-resolution image (.png file)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1avh3","text":"Spatial barcoding is performed with microfluidics system (Product code: AXO-0310).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"sgp","text":"The PCR product is mixed with SPRI magnetic beads and incubated for 10 min. A magnetic stand is used to collect the beads, thereby purifying the final PCR product, which is eluted in nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
